text: In contrast , interleukin-1beta-converting enzyme family protease inhibitors Ac-DEVD-CHO and CrmA blocked <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis .

These results suggest that peripheral T cells use distinct apoptosis signaling pathways with differential sensitivity to <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> interleukin-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - converting enzyme family protease inhibitors .

Since T cells normally express <extra_id_0> Bcl-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> Bcl-xL <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> following activation , their inability to block <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis may allow for the elimination of self-reactive cells and the appropriate regulation of immune responses .
